newsitem.title: FRANCE: PRESS DIGEST - FRANCE - LE MONDE DEC 27.
newsitem.headline: PRESS DIGEST - FRANCE - LE MONDE DEC 27.

text.p: These are leading stories in afternoon daily Le Monde, dated December 28.
-- Two million French people in sub-standard housing struggle against cold as sub-zero tempertures claim fifth death.

-- Support erodes for Gaullist RPR chairman of the Essonnes local council, Xavier Dugoin, who is caught up in allegations over an allegedly bogus report written for the council by the wide of the mayor of Paris -- his resignation is not excluded.
-- Algerian extremists concentrate armed attacks in and around the capital.

-- GAN orders assessment of property exposure, including 10 billion francs of bad loans owned by Baticredit subsidiary, in order to estimate cash injection needed from the government before privatisation and to spin off CIC bank subsidiary on favourable terms.
-- Second cancer lawsuit causes 1.4% dip to 217 francs in Seita share price.

-- 1996 was a record year for mergers with an estimated one trillion dollars' worth of deals worldwide, American firm Securities Data estimates. Prospect of low interest rates in 1997, lowering acquisition costs, means trend should continue.
